intro: Lagotis brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stemmed lagotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of blue or purple. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
